title: Table of mood scores set - median

content.description:
Researchers conducted a study to examine a new treatment for bipolar disorder. Researchers randomly assigned participants diagnosed with bipolar disorder to either Group 1, which received the new treatment, or Group 2, which received the standard treatment. 

The study focused on how the treatment affected the overall mood stability of participants compared with those who received the standard treatment. 

Participants self-reported mood stability scores based on a scale ranging from 1 (least stable) to 10 (most stable), with higher scores indicating greater stability and fewer bipolar symptoms. The data are shown in the tables.

Table 1: Group 1 Mood Stability Scores

content.question: Which of the following scores is the median mood stability score for participants in Group 1?

topic.text: 5.4: Selection of Categories of Psychological Disorders

skill.text: 3.B: Calculate and interpret measures of central tendency, variation, and percentile rank in a given data set.
